title: I Love LA: Rachel Sennott's Messy Millennial Drama Is the Funniest Show of 2025
shortdescription: Codependent friends, bad boyfriends, and Hollywood dreams – the dramedy you can't stop watching.
author: TV Insider

content.content: /images/I Love LA Rachel Sennott's Messy Millennial Drama.webp

Rachel Sennott (Shiva Baby, Bottoms) just dropped her HBO passion project I Love LA — a brutally funny, deeply chaotic half-hour dramedy about four codependent friends trying to “make it” in Hollywood while destroying their lives.

Think Girls meets Insecure with the unfiltered darkness of BoJack Horseman. The pilot ends with Sennott’s character accidentally live-streaming a mental breakdown — and it only gets messier from there.

Lines like “I’m not spiraling, I’m just in my villain origin story arc” and “We’re not broke, we’re pre-rich” are already all over TikTok. HBO quietly renewed it for Season 2 before Episode 3 even aired.
